title: Job Vacancies at Rhizome Consulting
content:
Rhizome Consulting - Our primary objective is to meet both the needs of our client and to exceed their expectations. We offer a broad range of services, tailored to our client specification with full confidentiality.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Chief Executive Officer

Job Location: Abuja
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	Are you a visionary leader with a passion for navigating complex risks and devising winning strategies? Join our client’s organisation and help chart the course for sustainable growth and success in a dynamic market landscape!
	The position holder will be a dynamic, ethical, and strategic leader with deep experience in the financial services sector, strong knowledge of Nigeria’s housing finance ecosystem, and a proven track record of delivering value to stakeholders.
	The position holder is expected to work closely with the Board to shape and implement the bank’s long-term vision, sustain regulatory compliance, drive profitability, and expand the bank’s presence and impact.


Job Responsibilities


	Provide strategic leadership and overall direction for the Bank in alignment with its mission, regulatory obligations, and stakeholder expectations.
	Develop and execute growth-oriented strategies that promote sustainable profitability and operational efficiency.
	Cultivate and maintain strong relationships with regulators (e.g., CBN, NDIC), industry stakeholders, and investors.
	Ensure full compliance with all banking and mortgage-related regulations and standards.
	Lead a high-performing executive team and foster a culture of accountability, innovation, and ethical conduct.
	Oversee risk management, corporate governance, and internal control frameworks.
	Champion digital transformation and product innovation to enhance customer experience.
	Represent the Bank in high-level engagements and communicate its vision effectively to internal and external audiences.
	Provide leadership and guidance during crises or challenging situations, demonstrating resilience, agility, and effective decision-making to mitigate risks and ensure business continuity.


Educational Qualification


	Bachelor’s degree in a related field of study required.
	A relevant Master’s degree or professional certification is highly desirable. 


Knowledge, Skills & Experiences:


	Minimum of 12 years of relevant experience in any reputable financial institution with proven track records of achievement, with at least 5 years at managerial position/s of a reputable financial institution.
	Deep understanding of the mortgage banking industry coupled with strategic thinking skills is vital.
	Strong analytical skills are essential for evaluating financial data and assessing the bank's risk exposure.
	Thorough knowledge of regulatory requirements governing mortgage banking is critical.
	The ability to make informed and timely decisions is paramount.
	Strong leadership and change management skills.
	Excellent communication, negotiation, and stakeholder management abilities.


Click here to apply online

Note


	Our client is committed to fostering an inclusive workplace where diversity is celebrated. We do not discriminate based on age, gender, ethnicity, or any other factor.
	We strongly encourage female candidates to apply and bring their unique perspectives to the team.


 

2.) Chief Digital Transformation Officer

Job Location: Abuja
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	Are you a tech-savvy strategist passionate about transforming legacy systems into agile, data-driven platforms? As Chief Digital Transformation Officer, you will lead the organisation’s digital innovation journey, championing technology-driven solutions that enhance customer experience, operational efficiency, and growth.


Job Responsibilities


	Lead the development and execution of the organisation’s digital transformation strategy.
	Oversee the integration of modern technology solutions into core banking, customer engagement, and internal operations.
	Champion innovation by identifying and deploying emerging technologies that enhance service delivery and customer experience.
	Collaborate with product, operations, and finance teams to digitise processes and improve efficiency.
	Work closely with senior leadership to align digital initiatives with overall business goals.
	Manage enterprise IT architecture, cybersecurity, and cloud-based systems.
	Ensure regulatory compliance and data security across digital platforms.
	Build and lead cross-functional teams focused on digital product development and systems optimisation.
	Monitor industry trends and competitor activities to maintain technological leadership.


Educational Qualification


	Bachelor’s degree in information technology, Computer Science, Engineering or related field.
	A Master’s degree or MBA is preferred.
	Relevant professional certifications are an added advantage.


Knowledge, Skills & Experiences:


	Minimum of 10 years of experience in digital strategy, IT leadership, or technology consulting, with at least 5 years in a senior management role.
	Strong background in digital transformation within financial services (preferably banking or fintech).
	Proven experience implementing enterprise-wide digital systems (e.g., core banking platforms, CRM, mobile/web applications).
	Excellent understanding of cloud computing, data analytics, AI/ML tools, and cybersecurity protocols.
	Demonstrated success in leading digital innovation and change management initiatives.
	Strong leadership and stakeholder management skills.


Click here to apply online

Note


	Our client is committed to fostering an inclusive workplace where diversity is celebrated. We do not discriminate based on age, gender, ethnicity, or any other factor.
	We strongly encourage female candidates to apply and bring their unique perspectives to the team.


 

 

3.) Head Internal Auditor

Job Location: Abuja
Employment Type: Full Time

Job Summary


	We are currently seeking an exceptional senior executive to drive our mission of financial empowerment and growth
	Are you a meticulous professional with an eye for detail? We are seeking a seasoned Internal Auditor to spearhead the Internal Control Audit division.
	If you thrive in ensuring compliance and uncovering opportunities for enhancement, we want to hear from you!


Job Responsibilities


	Own the design, implementation, documentation, assessment and monitoring internal control framework, including policies and key risks to ensure that the bank has adequate controls to prevent unintentional and intentional errors in financial reporting, processes and business operations.
	Formulate policies and procedures to improve internal controls, compliance and efficiency.
	Lead the process for internal controls reviews across the bank.
	Deliver adequate and timely reporting on the internal control framework and control deficiencies to ensure appropriate communication, documentation, escalation to business partners, senior leadership and audit committee.
	Deliver adequate and timely action plans and monitor progress to address and resolve control deficiencies.
	Work collaboratively with business and process owners to implement and monitor remediation efforts that result from internal control assessments, ensuring the effective implementation of corrective action.
	Actively seek standardisation and automation, apply and implement best practices for managing internal controls and deploy innovative technology where possible to enhance and continuously improve the design and operating effectiveness of the controls, documentation, assessment and review procedures.


Educational Qualification


	Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting, Finance or related fields is required.
	A Master’s degree is preferred.
	Relevant professional Certification is an added advantage.


Knowledge, Skills & Experience:


	A minimum of 10 years of experience in the financial industry with at least 4 years of experience in leadership.
	Solid understanding and experience with internal control frameworks.
	Strong analytical skills, including the ability to spot, assess and address risk, materiality and interdependence and translate it into impact analysis for financial reporting and recommendations for improvement.
	Strong communication skills-presenting internal control and risk matters in an understandable way across various forums and levels of organisations with the right level of detail.
	Strong oral and written communication skills, including sound presentational skills.
	Adaptable to working in a fast-paced, ever-changing environment.
	Striving for continuous improvement and optimisation.
	Ability to work well independently as well as the ability to work well with stakeholders and communicate the benefits of tax initiatives.
	Flexibility in resolving issues and addressing changing priorities.


Click here to apply online

 

4.) Office Assistant

Job Location: Abuja
Employment Type: Full Time

Summary


	As an Office Assistant, you will be responsible for supporting day-to-day administrative and operational tasks to ensure the office runs efficiently.
	This role includes handling clerical duties, providing support to staff and visitors, maintaining office supplies, and performing errands as needed.
	The ideal candidate is reliable, detail-oriented, and able to multitask in a dynamic environment.


Responsibilities


	Maintain the cleanliness and orderliness of office spaces
	Assist with filing, photocopying, scanning, and document organization
	Distribute mail, memos, and other correspondence to appropriate recipients
	Run errands such as picking up supplies, deliveries, or documents
	Monitor inventory and restock office and cleaning supplies
	Provide refreshments for meetings and guests as required
	Assist with basic data entry and record keeping
	Support administrative staff in preparing for meetings or events
	Welcome guests and direct them appropriately
	Ensure proper functioning of office equipment and report issues when necessary


Requirements


	B.Sc Degree in Social Science or any other relevant field of study.
	Previous experience in a similar role and Basic computer literacy (e.g., MS Word, Excel) is an added advantage


Knowledge, Skills & Experience


	1–2 years in a similar office support role
	Basic office procedures (filing, mail handling, record-keeping)
	Good communication and interpersonal skills
	Strong time management and reliability
	Attention to detail and ability to multitask
	Basic problem-solving and initiative
	Use of office equipment (printers, scanners, etc.)
	Workplace cleanliness, hygiene, and safety standards
	Inventory and supply management
	Confidentiality and basic customer service etiquette
	Experience working in structured office environments
	Exposure to supply tracking or administrative support tasks.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Applications to: vacancies@rhizomeng.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply

Operations Agent Job at Catilas Resources Limited




        
    

        
        Catilas Resources Limited is an outsourcing and advisory services Company. Our focus is to help our clients leverage their core capabilities to optimize market opportunities.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Operations Agent

Job Location: Ajah, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities


	Handle operational tasks efficiently
	Ensure smooth day-to-day activities
	Provide excellent support.


Requirements
     

            
    




	HND / B.Sc Degree holder
	Relevant experience in operations
	Age limit: 30 years.


Salary
N130,000 Monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: Hr@catilas.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note: Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Junior Audit Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Ketu, Lagos
Job type: Full-time
Industry: Manufacturing

Key Responsibilities


	Verify loading against dispatch notes, invoices, and waybills to ensure accuracy.
	Ensure compliance with internal control procedures during dispatch.
	Work with auditors to ensure correct documentation and reconciliation of goods.
	Maintain loading records for audit purposes and generate daily reports.
	Liaise with warehouse, transport, and audit teams to improve dispatch accuracy.
	Inspect vehicle condition and ensure goods are securely loaded to prevent damage.
	Document all variances or discrepancies in the loading process.
	Enforce safety and security measures in the loading zone.
	Supervise and coordinate all loading operations at the dispatch point.
	Train and manage loaders to ensure efficient and compliant loading practices.


Requirements


	OND/HND/BSc in Logistics, Accounting, Business Administration, or related field.
	0 &ndash; 1 years in logistics, warehousing, or audit-related roles.
	Strong attention to detailKnowledge of inventory and loading procedures
	Familiarity with audit/compliance requirements
	Proficient in Microsoft Excel and reporting tools


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their CV to:&nbsp;ololade@wemydrbrowns.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

Junior Audit Officer Job at Wemy Industries Limited




        
    

        
        Wemy Industries is one of the foremost indigenous and oldest established manufacturers in Lagos, Nigeria. We specialize in producing baby diapers, feminine sanitary napkins/pads, panty liners, adult diapers, maternity pads, under pads and baby wipes under the umbrella brand names of ‘Dr. Browns’ and ‘Nightingale’

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Junior Audit Officer

Job Location: Ketu, Lagos
Job type: Full-time
Industry: Manufacturing

Key Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Verify loading against dispatch notes, invoices, and waybills to ensure accuracy.
	Ensure compliance with internal control procedures during dispatch.
	Work with auditors to ensure correct documentation and reconciliation of goods.
	Maintain loading records for audit purposes and generate daily reports.
	Liaise with warehouse, transport, and audit teams to improve dispatch accuracy.
	Inspect vehicle condition and ensure goods are securely loaded to prevent damage.
	Document all variances or discrepancies in the loading process.
	Enforce safety and security measures in the loading zone.
	Supervise and coordinate all loading operations at the dispatch point.
	Train and manage loaders to ensure efficient and compliant loading practices.


Requirements


	OND/HND/BSc in Logistics, Accounting, Business Administration, or related field.
	0 – 1 years in logistics, warehousing, or audit-related roles.
	Strong attention to detailKnowledge of inventory and loading procedures
	Familiarity with audit/compliance requirements
	Proficient in Microsoft Excel and reporting tools


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their CV to: ololade@wemydrbrowns.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "IT Administrator",
  "description": "Skyline International Tourism and Hospitality Limited (SITH) was established in 2019 as the hospitality division of the Skyline Group in Nigeria. SITH is the franchisee for Pizza Hut in Nigeria (all regions except Lagos). Pizza Hut is part of Yum Brands (formerly PepsiCo Restaurants). Skyline International Tourism and Hospitality is the&nbsp;fastest-growing F&amp;B company in Nigeria.

StrEat Caf&eacute; is a brand curated by the team at Skyline International Tourism &amp; Hospitality Ltd. StrEat caf&eacute; is an amalgamation of food and beverages from various parts of the world, served in a charming and relaxed ambience. To top it off, we have carefully crafted M&ouml;venpick Ice Cream with the Alpine Spirit. The way we take care of our cows Matilda, Sophie and Candy, the one that inspires us to passionately pick the right natural ingredients to craft every M&ouml;venpick Ice Cream.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: IT&nbsp;Administrator

Job Location:&nbsp;Abuja (FCT)&nbsp;
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities


	System Management:&nbsp;Installing, configuring, and maintaining servers, networks, and hardware.
	Software Management:&nbsp;Installing, updating, and troubleshooting software, operating systems, and applications.
	User Support:&nbsp;Providing technical assistance and support to end-users, including troubleshooting hardware and software issues.
	Security:&nbsp;Implementing and maintaining security measures such as firewalls, antivirus software, and access controls.
	Backups and Disaster Recovery:&nbsp;Performing regular backups and implementing disaster recovery plans to protect data and ensure business continuity.
	Monitoring and Maintenance:&nbsp;Monitoring system performance, identifying potential issues, and performing necessary maintenance tasks.
	Documentation:&nbsp;Creating and maintaining documentation for IT systems, procedures, and user guides.
	Project Management:&nbsp;Participating in IT projects, such as system upgrades and new technology implementations.


Skills and Qualifications


	Experience:&nbsp;5+ years of experience in IT support or system administration is often preferred.
	Technical Skills:&nbsp;Strong knowledge of computer hardware, software, networks, and operating systems (Windows, Linux, macOS).
	Troubleshooting Skills:&nbsp;Ability to diagnose and resolve technical issues effectively.
	Communication Skills:&nbsp;Excellent verbal and written communication skills to interact with users and other team members.
	Problem-Solving Skills:&nbsp;Ability to analyze complex problems and develop effective solutions.
	Organizational Skills:&nbsp;Ability to manage multiple tasks, prioritize work, and meet deadlines.
	Security Awareness:&nbsp;Understanding of security best practices and ability to implement security measures.
	Very professional.
	Very discreet.
	Must live around the Gwarimpa, Life Camp, Kubwa, Jabi environs.


Salary
N200,000 - N250,000 monthly.&nbsp;

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;bookrichy@yahoo.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",

IT Administrator Job at Skyline International Tourism & Hospitality Limited (SITH)




        
    

        
        Skyline International Tourism and Hospitality Limited (SITH) was established in 2019 as the hospitality division of the Skyline Group in Nigeria. SITH is the franchisee for Pizza Hut in Nigeria (all regions except Lagos). Pizza Hut is part of Yum Brands (formerly PepsiCo Restaurants). Skyline International Tourism and Hospitality is the fastest-growing F&B company in Nigeria.
     

            
    



StrEat Café is a brand curated by the team at Skyline International Tourism & Hospitality Ltd. StrEat café is an amalgamation of food and beverages from various parts of the world, served in a charming and relaxed ambience. To top it off, we have carefully crafted Mövenpick Ice Cream with the Alpine Spirit. The way we take care of our cows Matilda, Sophie and Candy, the one that inspires us to passionately pick the right natural ingredients to craft every Mövenpick Ice Cream.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: IT Administrator

Job Location: Abuja (FCT) 
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities


	System Management: Installing, configuring, and maintaining servers, networks, and hardware.
	Software Management: Installing, updating, and troubleshooting software, operating systems, and applications.
	User Support: Providing technical assistance and support to end-users, including troubleshooting hardware and software issues.
	Security: Implementing and maintaining security measures such as firewalls, antivirus software, and access controls.
	Backups and Disaster Recovery: Performing regular backups and implementing disaster recovery plans to protect data and ensure business continuity.
	Monitoring and Maintenance: Monitoring system performance, identifying potential issues, and performing necessary maintenance tasks.
	Documentation: Creating and maintaining documentation for IT systems, procedures, and user guides.
	Project Management: Participating in IT projects, such as system upgrades and new technology implementations.


Skills and Qualifications


	Experience: 5+ years of experience in IT support or system administration is often preferred.
	Technical Skills: Strong knowledge of computer hardware, software, networks, and operating systems (Windows, Linux, macOS).
	Troubleshooting Skills: Ability to diagnose and resolve technical issues effectively.
	Communication Skills: Excellent verbal and written communication skills to interact with users and other team members.
	Problem-Solving Skills: Ability to analyze complex problems and develop effective solutions.
	Organizational Skills: Ability to manage multiple tasks, prioritize work, and meet deadlines.
	Security Awareness: Understanding of security best practices and ability to implement security measures.
	Very professional.
	Very discreet.
	Must live around the Gwarimpa, Life Camp, Kubwa, Jabi environs.


Salary
N200,000 - N250,000 monthly. 

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: bookrichy@yahoo.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply
